intro: Siphocampylus reticulatus, commonly known as the net-veined siphocampylus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
